source: Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs, Nebraska 211, VA Nebraska, Nebraska Department of Labor

resources.name: Nebraska 211
resources.description: 24/7/365 helpline available to veterans, military members and their families connecting to support services for housing, mental health, financial concerns, and more

resources.name: Nebraska Department of Veterans' Affairs
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive benefits, housing, employment, mental health, and support services to Nebraska veterans

resources.name: Omaha VA Community Resource and Referral Center (CRRC)
resources.description: VA facility providing referrals and connections to community resources for veterans

resources.name: Veterans Affairs Emergency Housing Hotline
resources.description: 24/7 emergency housing assistance hotline for veterans

resources.name: HUD-VASH Program (Nebraska)
resources.phone: Contact through VA or Housing Authority
resources.description: Provides housing vouchers to low income, disabled and chronically homeless veterans and their families

resources.name: Supportive Services For Veteran Families (SSVF) Program
resources.description: Provides case management, financial assistance, and emergency housing support to very low-income veterans and families

resources.name: Nebraska Veterans' Gateway
resources.description: Online resource platform with veteran employment tools, job conversion database, and training resources

resources.name: Nebraska Department of Labor - Veterans Employment Services
resources.description: State employment services with priority hiring preference for eligible Nebraska veterans

resources.name: Omaha Military & Family Helpline
resources.description: Dedicated support service for veterans, active duty personnel and families powered by United Way 211

resources.name: Mental Health Crisis Lines (Nebraska)
resources.description: 24/7 crisis support for mental health and substance abuse issues
